meanings.definition: Situated away from or opposite to the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The aboral side of the starfish is not where it eats.
meanings.sent2: The aboral region of the jellyfish is where its tentacles are located.
meanings.sent3: The aboral direction for the sea anemone to eat would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: The aboral view of the sea creature revealed a hidden beauty.
meanings.sent5: The aboral position of the crab's eyes made it look like a curious observer.

meanings.definition: Relating to the side or end of an animal opposite the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The aboral fin of the fish helped it steer in the water.
meanings.sent2: The aboral anatomy of the sea urchin is fascinating to study.
meanings.sent3: The aboral perspective of the snail showed a different world.
meanings.sent4: The aboral comparison of the two creatures highlighted their differences.
meanings.sent5: The aboral markings on the butterflyfish were strikingly beautiful.

meanings.definition: Directed away from or opposite to the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The aboral movement of the sea star was graceful and slow.
meanings.sent2: The aboral orientation of the sea cucumber helps it feed efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The aboral path the octopus took led to an unexpected discovery.
meanings.sent4: The aboral journey of the hermit crab was full of surprises.
meanings.sent5: The aboral route of the sea turtle was filled with colorful coral reefs.
